programme.desc: Today we’re in Namang’ang’a village, in Mukono. And we’re here to meet with Robert Ssebuyungu, the chairman of a group of 30 farmers called Balikyewunya. programme.title: Denver, the Last Dinosaur
Denver, the Last Dinosaur
programme.desc: It is late Spring when Wally, Jeremy, Shades and Mario are at the La Brea Tar Pits working on a school research project. They discover a mysterious tar egg that cracks open to reveal a friendly dinosaur, whom they name "Denver." Keeping their pet dino a secret is a challenge when rock concert promoter Morton Fizzback makes repeated attempts to capture the young dino and use him as the star in his rock 'n' roll show.

It is late Spring when Wally, Jeremy, Shades and Mario are at the La Brea Tar Pits working on a school research project. They discover a mysterious tar egg that cracks open to reveal a friendly dinosaur, whom they name "Denver." Keeping their pet dino a secret is a challenge when rock concert promoter Morton Fizzback makes repeated attempts to capture the young dino and use him as the star in his rock 'n' roll show.

programme.title: DENVER THE LAST DINOSAUR
programme.desc: Following Jeremy to his job at the supermarket, Denver hides in the storeroom and stuffs himself full of potato chips. Meanwhile, Casey heads from the La Brea Tar Pits with Wally's dog, Rocky, to look for another dinosaur. Sitting on the remains of Denver's tar shell, she and Rocky drift back in time to a prehistoric jungle

programme.title: DENVER THE LAST DINOSAUR 3
programme.desc: Wally borrows his sister Heather's video camera and the starry-eyed kids set out to make a video--starring themselves. As they squabble over leading roles, Denver wanders off with the camera and inadvertently tapes an auto theft ring stealing a truck. While looking for Denver, Wally is captured by the unscrupulous thieves. But Denver alerts the boys, who rescue Wally and catch the thieves.

programme.title: Denver, the Last Dinosaur
programme.sub-title: S1.E4 ∙ The Monster of Lost Lake

programme.title: Heart Beat
Heart Beat
programme.desc: Rüzgar goes to Bosnia after losing the woman he loves in a car crash two years ago, to run away from everything and everyone but mostly his memories.. He doesn’t make contact with anyone for two years, including his family. His uncle Kemaç and his mother Vahide who is the owner of a major corporation in Turkey, find Ruzgar after long efforts. So Kemal goes to Bosnia to bring Rüzgar back. But Rüzgar is still heartbroken. He can’t live like this so he runs away after a family dinner without telling anyone. He finds himself in Foça after meeting with a taxi driver. Meanwhile Zeynep is about to marry her childhood love Kutay. There’s only a week until the wedding, while the preparations continue Zeynep learns that she was cheated on. She goes to Foça to her most dear grandpa Muammer and aunt Ayla. However, she faints just before she could get there, right in front of Rüzgar’s house. She hides her true identity from everyone except Rüzgar. Afterwards, Zeynep is forced to see Kutay as her best friend Hande is getting married. Sibel, Başak and Hande think up a plan. But they need Rüzgar to make this plan work. Rüzgar can’t say no to this after hearing what happened to Zeynep. So a game of hearts begins between Zeynep and Rüzgar.

Afterwards, Zeynep is forced to see Kutay as her best friend Hande is getting married. Sibel, Başak and Hande think up a plan. But they need Rüzgar to make this plan work. Rüzgar can’t say no to this after hearing what happened to Zeynep. So a game of hearts begins between Zeynep and Rüzgar.

programme.title: Shamba Shape Up
Shamba Shape Up
programme.sub-title: Dairy, Soil test, Banana, Crop Rotation and Vegetables
Dairy, Soil test, Banana, Crop Rotation and Vegetables
programme.desc:
Today we’re in Kirangira Village, Mukono central and we’re meeting with farmer Dorothy Nakalembe. Dorothy’s a very experienced lady who’s been farming since 1980. She has a 3-acre farm where she grows bananas, maize and vegetables .She also has cows but she needs expert advice on them and of course for her vegetables. This is one farmer who knows what she wants!
In this farm we are learning about:
1. Dairy breeding, nutrition and hygiene 2. What to plant after Clearing Banana plantation 3. Soil testing on banana plantation 4. Vegetables transplanting and good farming practices
Today we’re in Kirangira Village, Mukono central and we’re meeting with farmer Dorothy Nakalembe.

programme.title: Shamba Shape Up Series 1
Shamba Shape Up Series 1
programme.desc:
Today we’re in Bulika village in Mukono and we’re visiting farmer Olivia Kiwombeeka. A very hard-working lady and mother to 14 children. She has a 4-acre farm where she grows coffee, bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, beans! And don’t forget the cows, the pigs, the goats, the chicken, the pigeons!!!
Where does she find the energy???
In this farm we are learning about:
1. Soil fertility and manure drying and soil testing 2. Pests and diseases control in Coffee plantation 3. Bananas: Good farming practices 4. Orange Fleshed Sweet Potatoes

Today we’re in Bulika village in Mukono and we’re visiting farmer Olivia Kiwombeeka. A very hard-working lady and mother to 14 children. She has a 4-acre farm where she grows coffee, bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, beans! And don’t forget the cows, the pigs, the goats, the chicken, the pigeons!!!

programme.title: Shamba Shape Up Series 1
Shamba Shape Up Series 1
programme.sub-title: Shamba Shape Up Series 1 - Ep 3: Tomatoes, Cow Care, Chickens
programme.desc: Meet Jeremiah Who inherited his grandfather's farm with all its problems. Jeremiah learns how to manage his tomatoes, dairy & poultry.
Meet Jeremiah Who inherited his grandfather's farm with all its problems. Jeremiah learns how to manage his tomatoes, dairy & poultry.

programme.title: Shamba Shape Up Series 1
programme.desc: Arthur seeks advice from the SSU team on his banana crop, broiler chickens, and pest control for his fruit trees.

programme.title: TED Talk
programme.sub-title: The case for a decentralized internet | Tamas Kocsis
programme.desc: Who controls the internet? Increasingly, the answer is large corporations and governments -- a trend that's threatening digital privacy and access to information online, says web developer Tamas Kocsis. In this informative talk, Kocsis breaks down the different threats to internet freedom and shares his plan to build an alternative, decentralized network that returns power to everyday users.

programme.title: The Nativity Story
programme.desc: In Nazareth, teenager Mary is betrothed to the local carpenter, Joseph. Mary is visited by an angel and told that she will fulfill a prophecy and as a virgin give birth to God's son, the savior of the world. Mary's pregnancy brings her the scorn of the community and Joseph struggles to believe her seemingly outlandish story. Meanwhile, a census forces every man and his family to return to his place of birth. Joseph and Mary set out on a long and arduous journey to Bethlehem. This story is based on the Biblical account of the birth of Jesus Christ.

programme.title: TED Talk
programme.sub-title: Kasiva Mutua: How I use the drum to tell my story | TED
programme.desc: In this talk-performance hybrid, drummer, percussionist and TED Fellow Kasiva Mutua shares how she's breaking the taboo against female drummers in Kenya -- and her mission to teach the significance and importance of the drum to young boys, women and girls. "Women can be custodians of culture, too," Mutua says.

programme.title: The Nativity Story
